intro: Lippia gossweileri, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Lippia gossweileri is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other riparian habitats. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal remedies.
